title: Energy-guided Entropic Neural Optimal Transport. (arXiv:2304.06094v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Energy-Based Models (EBMs) are known in the Machine Learning community for the decades. Since the seminal works devoted to EBMs dating back to the noughties there have been appearing a lot of efficient methods which solve the generative modelling problem by means of energy potentials (unnormalized likelihood functions). In contrast, the realm of Optimal Transport (OT) and, in particular, neural OT solvers is much less explored and limited by few recent works (excluding WGAN based approaches which utilize OT as a loss function and do not model OT maps themselves). In our work, we bridge the gap between EBMs and Entropy-regularized OT. We present the novel methodology which allows utilizing the recent developments and technical improvements of the former in order to enrich the latter. translated_title: 能量引导的熵神经最优输运
translated_abstract: 能量基础模型（EBMs）在机器学习社区已经有数十年的历史。自两千年代起，一直有很多高效的方法通过能量势（非归一化的似然函数）来解决生成建模问题。相比之下，最优输运（OT）领域，尤其是神经OT求解器，受到的探索要少得多，仅有一些近期的研究（不包括利用OT作为损失函数来解决问题的WGAN方法）。在本研究中，我们弥合了EBMs和熵正则化OT之间的差距，提出了一种新的方法，允许利用前者的最新发展和技术改进来丰富后者。我们在2D情景和标准的图像到图像翻译问题中验证了我们方法的适用性。为简单起见，我们选择了简短和长跑的EBMs。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种新的方法，将能量基础模型和熵正则化最优输运结合起来，以解决生成建模问题。我们在2D情景和图像到图像翻译问题中验证了该方法的适用性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel method that combines energy-based models (EBMs) with entropy-regularized optimal transport (OT) to solve generative modeling problems. The applicability of the method is validated in toy 2D scenarios and standard image-to-image translation problems.
